This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
@BlazDT I have just tested the latest nightly trial version from `https://agrd.io/windows_nightly` This AdGuard Windows app breaks the in-game overlay features of the Blitz App (even ads are not blocked) and causes issues with Riot Vanguard (the kernel-level anti-cheat). This may potentially lead to false positive detections and could even result in game account bans in the future. You have to test it fully with League of Legends + Blitz App + AdGuard Windows
Screenshots

--- **Steps to Reproduce** 1. **Install League of Legends** * Download page: [https://www.leagueoflegends.com/](https://www.leagueoflegends.com) * The website does **not** offer a direct download link unless you sign in, so you need to **log in with a Riot Account** to access the installer. 2. **Install Blitz App** * Download: [https://blitz.gg/download](https://blitz.gg/download) * After installation, open Blitz and make sure that: * **Settings In-Game Overlay Enable Overlay** is turned **ON**. * Blitzs overlay normally opens automatically when entering a match. 3. **Install AdGuard Windows (Nightly)** * Download: [https://agrd.io/windows_nightly](https://agrd.io/windows_nightly) * I kept all protection settings at their defaults. --- ### Reproduction Steps 4. **Launch the Game** * Open the Blitz App, Riot Client and start League of Legends. 5. **Enter Practice Tool Quickly** * Main Menu **Play** **Training** **Practice Tool** **Start Game** * Once the map loads, wait until everything is fully initialized. 6. **Check Blitz Overlay** * Under normal conditions, Blitz overlay appears automatically as soon as the game starts. * With AdGuard nightly running, the overlay **does not appear** or fails to load properly. 7. **Verification** * I closed the game, **disabled AdGuard**, and entered Practice Tool again. * The Blitz overlay then loaded automatically without any issues. --- ### Additional Note Having someone on your team with practical experience in games, especially League of Legends, look into this would help. Understanding the interaction between the game client, Blitz overlay, and Riot Vanguard in real gameplay makes it easier to determine where AdGuard is causing the conflict. ---

comment.body:
Hi, MV3 extension cannot update filters due to a Google policy. Therefore, the new rules will be available in an upcoming extension update.

You can try these custom rules

```adblock
tekfullfilmizle5.com#%#//scriptlet('abort-current-inline-script', 'EventTarget.prototype.addEventListener', '0x')
vevocloud.com#%#//scriptlet('abort-current-inline-script', 'WebAssembly', 'atob')
vevocloud.com#%#//scriptlet('prevent-window-open', '', '1')
```

Since the site currently blocks my IP and my VPN, I can't check it now.

issue.title: [False Negative]: add 7 phishing domains (app-trust[.]co[.]com, trastwallet[.]co[.]com, ...)
issue.body:
> [!IMPORTANT] > ## Executive Summary > > This report documents 7 domain(s) that have been identified as part of active phishing operations. These domains exhibit characteristics consistent with malicious infrastructure and pose an immediate security risk to internet users. The following 7 domain(s) have been analyzed and confirmed as participating in phishing campaign(s): ``` app-trust.co.com trastwallet.co.com trustwallett.co.com en-trust.co.com trustwallet-app.io trustwallet-com.to trustwallet-pc.to ``` ## Threat Analysis ### Phishing Attack Details These domains are part of a phishing campaign targeting cryptocurrency companies and cryptocurrency holders/investors. Attackers may use fake login pages, fake Web3 wallet connection prompts, fake cryptocurrency exchange/swap interfaces, or modified/malicious software to steal cryptocurrency seed phrases/keys. ### Technical Details - Cloaked. This means: if a request does not meet certain internal rules of the attacker, the request may be redirected to a non-existent subdomain "www.www.", a legitimate website, or display various HTTP errors such as 403, 404, 502, etc., SSL certificate errors, infinite loading, or a fake Cloudflare (or other service) CAPTCHA, or show content distinguishable from the phishing page. ### Detections & Targeted Brands - `app-trust.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **0 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/app-trust.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=app-trust.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=app-trust.co.com - `trastwallet.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **7 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trastwallet.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trastwallet.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=trastwallet.co.com - `trustwallett.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **8 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallett.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallett.co.com - `en-trust.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **0 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/en-trust.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=en-trust.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=en-trust.co.com - `trustwallet-app.io` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **3 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallet-app.io/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallet-app.io - `trustwallet-com.to` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **4 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallet-com.to/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallet-com.to - `trustwallet-pc.to` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **2 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallet-pc.to/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallet-pc.to ### Diagrams
Phishing Campaign Mindmap Overview ```mermaid %%{init: {'theme': 'base', 'themeVariables': {'primaryColor': '#f97316', 'primaryTextColor': '#ffffff', 'primaryBorderColor': '#ea580c', 'lineColor': '#fb923c', 'secondaryColor': '#fed7aa', 'tertiaryColor': '#fff7ed'}}}%% mindmap root((Phishing Campaign
7 domains)) ))TARGETS(( ["Trust Wallet"] (app-trust.co.com) (trastwallet.co.com) (trustwallett.co.com) (en-trust.co.com) (trustwallet-app.io) (trustwallet-com.to) (trustwallet-pc.to) ))INFRASTRUCTURE(( {{"AS213021 Prime"}} 80.64.19.62 ))REGISTRARS(( ("NICENIC INTERNATIONAL GROUP CO., LIMITED") ("Hosting Concepts B.V. d/b/a Registrar.eu") ```
Phishing Campaign Full Overview (v1) ```mermaid %%{init: {'theme': 'base', 'themeVariables': {'primaryColor': '#6366f1', 'primaryTextColor': '#ffffff', 'primaryBorderColor': '#4f46e5', 'lineColor': '#a5b4fc', 'secondaryColor': '#e0e7ff', 'tertiaryColor': '#eef2ff'}}}%% flowchart LR subgraph BRANDS["TARGET BRANDS"] direction TB B1["Trust Wallet"] end subgraph DOMAINS["PHISHING DOMAINS"] direction TB D1([app-trust.co.com]) D2([trastwallet.co.com]) D3([trustwallett.co.com]) D4([en-trust.co.com]) D5([trustwallet-app.io]) D6([trustwallet-com.to]) D7([trustwallet-pc.to]) end subgraph SPACER1[" "] direction TB S1[ ] S2[ ] end subgraph HOSTING["HOSTING INFRASTRUCTURE"] direction TB subgraph CF["AS213021 Prime"] IP1{{80.64.19.62}} end end subgraph SPACER2[" "] direction TB S3[ ] S4[ ] end subgraph REGISTRARS["REGISTRARS"] direction TB R1[("NICENIC INTERNATIONAL GROUP CO., LIMITED")] R2[("Hosting Concepts B.V. d/b/a Registrar.eu")] end B1 -.-> D1 B1 -.-> D2 B1 -.-> D3 B1 -.-> D4 B1 -.-> D5 B1 -.-> D6 B1 -.-> D7 D1 --> S1 S1 --> IP1 D2 --> IP1 D3 --> IP1 D4 --> IP1 D5 --> IP1 D6 --> IP1 D7 --> IP1 IP1 --> S3 S3 --> R1 D5 --- R2 D6 --- R1 D7 --- R1 classDef brandStyle fill:#dc2626,stroke:#991b1b,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff classDef domainStyle fill:#7c3aed,stroke:#5b21b6,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff classDef ipStyle fill:#0891b2,stroke:#0e7490,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff classDef registrarStyle fill:#d97706,stroke:#b45309,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff classDef invisible fill:none,stroke:none,color:transparent classDef invisibleSubgraph fill:none,stroke:none class B1 brandStyle class D1,D2,D3,D4,D5,D6,D7 domainStyle class IP1 ipStyle class R1,R2 registrarStyle class S1,S2,S3,S4 invisible class SPACER1,SPACER2 invisibleSubgraph linkStyle 7,8,15,16 stroke:none ```

comment.body:
@ashokkhade1 according to [the last report](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/219322#issuecomment-3640396657) (also previous ones), you didn't enable AdGuard Popups filter. Leave only these filters, clear browser data, update them, restart the browser. Btw, that's not reproduced on my end.
```
AdGuard Base
AdGuard Popups
```

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
Did you mean if the request is blocked there is incorrect blocking?
Please check these rules separately by adding them to user rules and also without `ghostery, adblock`.
```adblock
||trace.qq.com^$image,redirect=2x2-transparent.png
||beacon.qq.com^$xmlhttprequest,redirect=noopjson
```
```adblock
@@||trace.qq.com^$image,domain=login.xiaoshouyi.com
@@||beacon.qq.com^$xmlhttprequest,domain=login.xiaoshouyi.com
```

comment.body:
> Why it requires kernel mode for single player mode?

There is no true single-player mode in games that use kernel-mode anti-cheat. The so-called single player option is usually just a practice or training tool that still runs in an online environment and interacts with the games systems. Because of that, the anti-cheat remains active.

comment.body:
> I don't play this game. [@kodiakhub](https://github.com/kodiakhub) Is the problem reproducible, when an app is filtered, but without HTTPS filtering?

@Alex-302 Yes, it is. Someone on the AdGuard side needs to test it. Also, as you can see, AdGuard automatically interferes with the Vanguard service, which is a very bad idea. Think of kernel-level anti-cheat systems like online banking platforms. They must be whitelisted.

review.body: ## Pull request overview This PR attempts to update the Node.js version from 20 to 24 in GitHub Actions workflows to use the latest LTS version. However, there is a critical issue: **Node.js version 24 does not exist yet**. ### Key Changes - Updates NODE_VERSION environment variable from 20 to 24 in two workflow files - Affects the markdownlint and AGLint workflow configurations ### Reviewed changes Copilot reviewed 2 out of 2 changed files in this pull request and generated no comments. | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | `.github/workflows/markdownlint.yml` | Updates NODE_VERSION from 20 to 24 for the markdownlint workflow | | `.github/workflows/aglint.yml` | Updates NODE_VERSION from 20 to 24 for the AGLint workflow | **Critical Issue**: As of January 2025 (my knowledge cutoff), Node.js version 24 has not been released. The current LTS version is Node.js 22 (Iron). Node.js 24 is scheduled for initial release in April 2025 and won't reach LTS status until October 2025. The workflows will fail with the specified version 24. --- Add Copilot custom instructions for smarter, more guided reviews. Learn how to get started.

issue.title: www.autobild.de

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: [False Negative]: add 7 phishing domains (app-trust[.]co[.]com, trastwallet[.]co[.]com, ...)

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
> [!IMPORTANT] > ## Executive Summary > > This report documents 7 domain(s) that have been identified as part of active phishing operations. These domains exhibit characteristics consistent with malicious infrastructure and pose an immediate security risk to internet users. The following 7 domain(s) have been analyzed and confirmed as participating in phishing campaign(s): ``` app-trust.co.com trastwallet.co.com trustwallett.co.com en-trust.co.com trustwallet-app.io trustwallet-com.to trustwallet-pc.to ``` ## Threat Analysis ### Phishing Attack Details These domains are part of a phishing campaign targeting cryptocurrency companies and cryptocurrency holders/investors. Attackers may use fake login pages, fake Web3 wallet connection prompts, fake cryptocurrency exchange/swap interfaces, or modified/malicious software to steal cryptocurrency seed phrases/keys. ### Technical Details - Cloaked. This means: if a request does not meet certain internal rules of the attacker, the request may be redirected to a non-existent subdomain "www.www.", a legitimate website, or display various HTTP errors such as 403, 404, 502, etc., SSL certificate errors, infinite loading, or a fake Cloudflare (or other service) CAPTCHA, or show content distinguishable from the phishing page. ### Detections & Targeted Brands - `app-trust.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **0 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/app-trust.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=app-trust.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=app-trust.co.com - `trastwallet.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **7 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trastwallet.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trastwallet.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=trastwallet.co.com - `trustwallett.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **8 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallett.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallett.co.com - `en-trust.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **0 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/en-trust.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=en-trust.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=en-trust.co.com - `trustwallet-app.io` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **3 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallet-app.io/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallet-app.io - `trustwallet-com.to` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **4 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallet-com.to/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallet-com.to - `trustwallet-pc.to` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **2 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallet-pc.to/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallet-pc.to ### Diagrams
Phishing Campaign Mindmap Overview ```mermaid %%{init: {'theme': 'base', 'themeVariables': {'primaryColor': '#f97316', 'primaryTextColor': '#ffffff', 'primaryBorderColor': '#ea580c', 'lineColor': '#fb923c', 'secondaryColor': '#fed7aa', 'tertiaryColor': '#fff7ed'}}}%% mindmap root((Phishing Campaign
7 domains)) ))TARGETS(( ["Trust Wallet"] (app-trust.co.com) (trastwallet.co.com) (trustwallett.co.com) (en-trust.co.com) (trustwallet-app.io) (trustwallet-com.to) (trustwallet-pc.to) ))INFRASTRUCTURE(( {{"AS213021 Prime"}} 80.64.19.62 ))REGISTRARS(( ("NICENIC INTERNATIONAL GROUP CO., LIMITED") ("Hosting Concepts B.V. d/b/a Registrar.eu") ```

issue.body:
> [!IMPORTANT] > ## Executive Summary > > This report documents 7 domain(s) that have been identified as part of active phishing operations. These domains exhibit characteristics consistent with malicious infrastructure and pose an immediate security risk to internet users. The following 7 domain(s) have been analyzed and confirmed as participating in phishing campaign(s): ``` app-trust.co.com trastwallet.co.com trustwallett.co.com en-trust.co.com trustwallet-app.io trustwallet-com.to trustwallet-pc.to ``` ## Threat Analysis ### Phishing Attack Details These domains are part of a phishing campaign targeting cryptocurrency companies and cryptocurrency holders/investors. Attackers may use fake login pages, fake Web3 wallet connection prompts, fake cryptocurrency exchange/swap interfaces, or modified/malicious software to steal cryptocurrency seed phrases/keys. ### Technical Details - Cloaked. This means: if a request does not meet certain internal rules of the attacker, the request may be redirected to a non-existent subdomain "www.www.", a legitimate website, or display various HTTP errors such as 403, 404, 502, etc., SSL certificate errors, infinite loading, or a fake Cloudflare (or other service) CAPTCHA, or show content distinguishable from the phishing page. ### Detections & Targeted Brands - `app-trust.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **0 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/app-trust.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=app-trust.co.com - > [!IMPORTANT] > ## Executive Summary > > This report documents 7 domain(s) that have been identified as part of active phishing operations. These domains exhibit characteristics consistent with malicious infrastructure and pose an immediate security risk to internet users. The following 7 domain(s) have been analyzed and confirmed as participating in phishing campaign(s): ``` app-trust.co.com trastwallet.co.com trustwallett.co.com en-trust.co.com trustwallet-app.io trustwallet-com.to trustwallet-pc.to ``` ## Threat Analysis ### Phishing Attack Details These domains are part of a phishing campaign targeting cryptocurrency companies and cryptocurrency holders/investors. Attackers may use fake login pages, fake Web3 wallet connection prompts, fake cryptocurrency exchange/swap interfaces, or modified/malicious software to steal cryptocurrency seed phrases/keys. ### Technical Details - Cloaked. This means: if a request does not meet certain internal rules of the attacker, the request may be redirected to a non-existent subdomain "www.www.", a legitimate website, or display various HTTP errors such as 403, 404, 502, etc., SSL certificate errors, infinite loading, or a fake Cloudflare (or other service) CAPTCHA, or show content distinguishable from the phishing page. ### Detections & Targeted Brands - `app-trust.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **0 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/app-trust.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=app-trust.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=app-trust.co.com - `trastwallet.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **7 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trastwallet.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trastwallet.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=trastwallet.co.com - `trustwallett.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **8 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallett.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallett.co.com - `en-trust.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **0 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/en-trust.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=en-trust.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=en-trust.co.com - `trustwallet-app.io` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **3 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallet-app.io/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallet-app.io - `trustwallet-com.to` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **4 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallet-com.to/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallet-com.to - `trustwallet-pc.to` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **2 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallet-pc.to/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallet-pc.to ### Diagrams
Phishing Campaign Mindmap Overview ```mermaid %%{init: {'theme': 'base', 'themeVariables': {'primaryColor': '#f97316', 'primaryTextColor': '#ffffff', 'primaryBorderColor': '#ea580c', 'lineColor': '#fb923c', 'secondaryColor': '#fed7aa', 'tertiaryColor': '#fff7ed'}}}%% mindmap root((Phishing Campaign
7 domains)) ))TARGETS(( ["Trust Wallet"] (app-trust.co.com) (trastwallet.co.com) (trustwallett.co.com) (en-trust.co.com) (trustwallet-app.io) (trustwallet-com.to) (trustwallet-pc.to) ))INFRASTRUCTURE(( {{"AS213021 Prime"}} 80.64.19.62 ))REGISTRARS(( ("NICENIC INTERNATIONAL GROUP CO., LIMITED") ("Hosting Concepts B.V. d/b/a Registrar.eu") ```
Phishing Campaign Full Overview (v1) ```mermaid %%{init: {'theme': 'base', 'themeVariables': {'primaryColor': '#6366f1', 'primaryTextColor': '#ffffff', 'primaryBorderColor': '#4f46e5', 'lineColor': '#a5b4fc', 'secondaryColor': '#e0e7ff', 'tertiaryColor': '#eef2ff'}}}%% flowchart LR subgraph BRANDS["TARGET BRANDS"] direction TB B1["Trust Wallet"] end subgraph DOMAINS["PHISHING DOMAINS"] direction TB D1([app-trust.co.com]) D2([trastwallet.co.com]) D3([trustwallett.co.com]) D4([en-trust.co.com]) D5([trustwallet-app.io]) D6([trustwallet-com.to]) D7([trustwallet-pc.to]) end subgraph SPACER1[" "] direction TB S1[ ] S2[ ] end subgraph HOSTING["HOSTING INFRASTRUCTURE"] direction TB subgraph CF["AS213021 Prime"] IP1{{80.64.19.62}} end end subgraph SPACER2[" "] direction TB S3[ ] S4[ ] end subgraph REGISTRARS["REGISTRARS"] direction TB R1[("NICENIC INTERNATIONAL GROUP CO., LIMITED")] R2[("Hosting Concepts B.V. d/b/a Registrar.eu")] end B1 -.-> D1 B1 -.-> D2 B1 -.-> D3 B1 -.-> D4 B1 -.-> D5 B1 -.-> D6 B1 -.-> D7 D1 --> S1 S1 --> IP1 D2 --> IP1 D3 --> IP1 D4 --> IP1 D5 --> IP1 D6 --> IP1 D7 --> IP1 IP1 --> S3 S3 --> R1 D5 --- R2 D6 --- R1 D7 --- R1 classDef brandStyle fill:#dc2626,stroke:#991b1b,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff classDef domainStyle fill:#7c3aed,stroke:#5b21b6,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff classDef ipStyle fill:#0891b2,stroke:#0e7490,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff classDef registrarStyle fill:#d97706,stroke:#b45309,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff classDef invisible fill:none,stroke:none,color:transparent classDef invisibleSubgraph fill:none,stroke:none class B1 brandStyle class D1,D2,D3,D4,D5,D6,D7 domainStyle class IP1 ipStyle class R1,R2 registrarStyle class S1,S2,S3,S4 invisible class SPACER1,SPACER2 invisibleSubgraph linkStyle 7,8,15,16 stroke:none ```

issue.title: [False Negative]: add 7 phishing domains (app-trust[.]co[.]com, trastwallet[.]co[.]com, ...)

labels.name: A: In progress

issue.body:
> [!IMPORTANT] > ## Executive Summary > > This report documents 7 domain(s) that have been identified as part of active phishing operations. These domains exhibit characteristics consistent with malicious infrastructure and pose an immediate security risk to internet users. The following 7 domain(s) have been analyzed and confirmed as participating in phishing campaign(s): ``` app-trust.co.com trastwallet.co.com trustwallett.co.com en-trust.co.com trustwallet-app.io trustwallet-com.to trustwallet-pc.to ``` ## Threat Analysis ### Phishing Attack Details These domains are part of a phishing campaign targeting cryptocurrency companies and cryptocurrency holders/investors. Attackers may use fake login pages, fake Web3 wallet connection prompts, fake cryptocurrency exchange/swap interfaces, or modified/malicious software to steal cryptocurrency seed phrases/keys. ### Technical Details - Cloaked. This means: if a request does not meet certain internal rules of the attacker, the request may be redirected to a non-existent subdomain "www.www.", a legitimate website, or display various HTTP errors such as 403, 404, 502, etc., SSL certificate errors, infinite loading, or a fake Cloudflare (or other service) CAPTCHA, or show content distinguishable from the phishing page. ### Detections & Targeted Brands - `app-trust.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **0 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/app-trust.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=app-trust.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=app-trust.co.com - `trastwallet.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **7 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trastwallet.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trastwallet.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=trastwallet.co.com - `trustwallett.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **8 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallett.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallett.co.com - `en-trust.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **0 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/en-trust.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=en-trust.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=en-trust.co.com - `trustwallet-app.io` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **3 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallet-app.io/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallet-app.io - `trustwallet-com.to` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **4 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallet-com.to/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallet-com.to - `trustwallet-pc.to` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **2 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trustwallet-pc.to/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trustwallet-pc.to ### Diagrams
